disgorge.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if a vehicle or building disgorges people, they come out of it in a large group
disgorge.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Cars drew up to disgorge a wedding party.
disgorge.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if something disgorges what was inside it, it lets it pour out
disgorge.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Chimneys were disgorging smoke into the air.
disgorge.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if a river disgorges, it flows into the sea
disgorge.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The Mississippi disgorges its waters into the Gulf of Mexico.
disgorge.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to give back something that you have taken illegally
disgorge.translation[0].definitions[4].d: to bring food back up from your stomach through your mouth
